<JD_START>
Job Title: Procurement/Purchasing Specialist (automotive, heavy equip, or industrial manuf req)

Location: Portland, Oregon Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Procurement Specialist -- Great Hours & Work/Life Balance! Location: Portland, OR (Northern Portland) Base Salary: $60,000-$68,000 Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Short-Term Disability, 401k, Holidays, Sick Time, Accrued PTOJob Type: Full-Time (40 hours) Typical Hours: M-F, 7:30am-4pm Start Date: ASAPSponsorship is not available 
Procurement Specialist (buyer/purchasing exp. req.) Description 
Our client, a forward-thinking automotive services business, is looking for a Procurement Specialist to join their team in Portland, OR. In this position, you will be responsible for procuring high-quality automotive parts and components while effectively navigating supplier relationships. They’re looking for someone who prides themselves on their ability to be collaborative and build cohesion across different business segments while ultimately holding their vendors accountable. Someone who can be that data storyteller and uses KPIs to make more strategic decisions that lessen lead times, excess inventory, and costs. You’ll thrive in this role if you pride yourself on your ability to build and mend bridges across departments while championing a culture of operational efficiency. After all, you’re supporting procuring an inventory of 7m (annually) so attention to detail is paramount in this pivotal role. If you would be excited to help influence and execute a new supply chain strategy, this is the perfect opportunity to make the impact you’re looking for. You don’t have to compromise your work/life balance to play a key role in supporting the transformation and streamlining of a department. Don’t miss your chance to put your fingerprints on change with a company in growth mode. 
Procurement Specialist (buyer/purchasing exp. req.) Responsibilities
• Identify, evaluate, and onboard reliable suppliers and vendors • Develop and nurture strong relationships with suppliers • Work with vendors to optimize pricing, delivery schedules, and product quality• Evaluate schedules and inventory to accurately forecast demand for parts • Minimize lead times, excess inventory, and procurement costs• Implement quality control measures and address any quality issues promptly• Anticipate and proactively address supply chain disruptions or delays • Analyze data to identify opportunities for cost savings and performance enhancement• Monitor vendor performance, track deliveries, and coordinate with internal teams• Partner cross-functionally to ensure alignment and usher buy-in • Implement process improvements to enhance procurement efficiency
Procurement Specialist (buyer/purchasing exp. req.) Qualifications 
• 2+ years of automotive, heavy equipment, or industrial manufacturing experience required • 3+ years of purchasing experience required • Well-versed in managing and negotiating with suppliers required • Able to work onsite daily required

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
